verses.verse: I will stand<WH5975> upon my watch<WH4931>, and set<WH3320> me upon the tower<WH4692>, and will watch<WH6822> to see<WH7200> what he will say<WH1696> unto me, and what I shall answer<WH7725> when I am reproved<WH8433>. tower: Heb. fenced place unto me: or, in me when: or, when I am argued with: Heb. upon my reproof, or, arguing
And the LORD<WH3068> answered<WH6030> me, and said<WH559>, Write<WH3789> the vision<WH2377>, and make it plain<WH874> upon tables<WH3871>, that he may run<WH7323> that readeth<WH7121> it.

For the vision<WH2377> is yet for an appointed time<WH4150>, but at the end<WH7093> it shall speak<WH6315>, and not lie<WH3576>: though it tarry<WH4102>, wait<WH2442> for it; because it will surely<WH935> come<WH935>, it will not tarry<WH309>.
Behold, his soul<WH5315> which is lifted up<WH6075> is not upright<WH3474> in him: but the just<WH6662> shall live<WH2421> by his faith<WH530>.

Yea also, because he transgresseth<WH898> by wine<WH3196>, he is a proud<WH3093> man<WH1397>, neither keepeth at home<WH5115>, who enlargeth<WH7337> his desire<WH5315> as hell<WH7585>, and is as death<WH4194>, and cannot be satisfied<WH7646>, but gathereth<WH622> unto him all nations<WH1471>, and heapeth<WH6908> unto him all people<WH5971>: Yea: or, How much more

Shall not all these take up<WH5375> a parable<WH4912> against him, and a taunting<WH4426> proverb<WH2420> against him, and say<WH559>, Woe<WH1945> to him that increaseth<WH7235> that which is not his! how long? and to him that ladeth<WH3513> himself with thick clay<WH5671>! Woe: or, Ho, he
Shall they not rise up<WH6965> suddenly<WH6621> that shall bite<WH5391> thee, and awake<WH3364> that shall vex<WH2111> thee, and thou shalt be for booties<WH4933> unto them?

Because thou hast spoiled<WH7997> many<WH7227> nations<WH1471>, all the remnant<WH3499> of the people<WH5971> shall spoil<WH7997> thee; because of men's<WH120> blood<WH1818>, and for the violence<WH2555> of the land<WH776>, of the city<WH7151>, and of all that dwell<WH3427> therein. blood: Heb. bloods

Woe<WH1945> to him that coveteth<WH1214> an evil<WH7451> covetousness<WH1215> to his house<WH1004>, that he may set<WH7760> his nest<WH7064> on high<WH4791>, that he may be delivered<WH5337> from the power<WH3709> of evil<WH7451>! coveteth: or, gaineth and evil gain power: Heb. palm of the hand
Thou hast consulted<WH3289> shame<WH1322> to thy house<WH1004> by cutting off<WH7096> many<WH7227> people<WH5971>, and hast sinned<WH2398> against thy soul<WH5315>.
For the stone<WH68> shall cry out<WH2199> of the wall<WH7023>, and the beam out<WH3714> of the timber<WH6086> shall answer<WH6030> it. beam: or, piece, or, fastening answer it: or, witness against it
Woe<WH1945> to him that buildeth<WH1129> a town<WH5892> with blood<WH1818>, and stablisheth<WH3559> a city<WH7151> by iniquity<WH5766>! blood: Heb. bloods

Behold, is it not of the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> that the people<WH5971> shall labour<WH3021> in the very<WH1767> fire<WH784>, and the people<WH3816> shall weary<WH3286> themselves for very<WH1767> vanity<WH7385>? for: or, in vain?
For the earth<WH776> shall be filled<WH4390> with the knowledge<WH3045> of the glory<WH3519> of the LORD<WH3068>, as the waters<WH4325> cover<WH3680> the sea<WH3220>. with: or, by knowing the glory

Woe<WH1945> unto him that giveth his neighbour<WH7453> drink<WH8248>, that puttest<WH5596> thy bottle<WH2573> to him, and makest him drunken<WH7937> also, that thou mayest look<WH5027> on their nakedness<WH4589>!

Thou art filled<WH7646> with shame<WH7036> for glory<WH3519>: drink<WH8354> thou also, and let thy foreskin be uncovered<WH6188>: the cup<WH3563> of the LORD'S<WH3068> right hand<WH3225> shall be turned<WH5437> unto thee, and shameful spewing<WH7022> shall be on thy glory<WH3519>. with: or, more with shame than with glory

For the violence<WH2555> of Lebanon<WH3844> shall cover<WH3680> thee, and the spoil<WH7701> of beasts<WH929>, which made them afraid<WH2865>, because of men's<WH120> blood<WH1818>, and for the violence<WH2555> of the land<WH776>, of the city<WH7151>, and of all that dwell<WH3427> therein.

What profiteth<WH3276> the graven image<WH6459> that the maker<WH3335> thereof hath graven<WH6458> it; the molten image<WH4541>, and a teacher<WH3384> of lies<WH8267>, that the maker<WH3335> of his work<WH3336> trusteth<WH982> therein, to make<WH6213> dumb<WH483> idols<WH457>? maker of: Heb. fashioner of his fashion

Woe<WH1945> unto him that saith<WH559> to the wood<WH6086>, Awake<WH6974>; to the dumb<WH1748> stone<WH68>, Arise<WH5782>, it shall teach<WH3384>! Behold, it is laid<WH8610> over with gold<WH2091> and silver<WH3701>, and there is no breath<WH7307> at all in the midst<WH7130> of it.
But the LORD<WH3068> is in his holy<WH6944> temple<WH1964>: let all the earth<WH776> keep silence<WH2013> before<WH6440> him. let: Heb. be silent all the earth before him
